clinical_study.brief_title: Vascular Access in Cancer Patients - PICC vs PORT in a Randomized Controlled Trial.
clinical_study.official_title: Vascular Access in Cancer Patients - PICC vs PORT in a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: As of today there is very limited scientific knowledge in whicj of the two vascular access devices (PICC-line or venous ports) that offers the lowest complicationrates in cancerpatients. The study group wants to clearify this unsolved matter by comparing the two systems. Our primary endpoint is the presens of catheter related venous thrombosis. We are also looking at all catheter related complications and patient satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: The occurence of catheter related venous thrombosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon clinical suspiscion during the one the patient i enrolled in the study

intervention.intervention_name: Randomization between two well established clinical routine vascular access devices

study_pop.textblock: Patients with cancer and the need for central venous access

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- cancer treatment with need for central venous access
- Age >18 yrs
- Suspected survival > 4 weeks
- Need of central venous access >4 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing uncontrolled systemic infection
- Prescence of significant thrombosis/stenosis in arm or central veins
- Unability to communicate
- Probable upcoming need for dialysis fistula
